problems.title: Distinct Numbers in Each Subarray (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
You are given an integer array nums of length n and an integer k. Your task is to find the number of distinct elements in every subarray of size k within nums.
Return an array ans such that ans[i] is the count of distinct elements in nums[i..(i + k - 1)].

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and k.
Second line: n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print space-separated integers representing the count of distinct elements in each subarray.
hintsList: Use a hash map or frequency array to count occurrences of elements in the current window.
When sliding the window, decrement the count of the element leaving and increment the count of the element entering.
